content: MEXICO CITY, May 2 (Reuters) - Mexican Deputy Foreign Minister Martha Delgado is resigning from her post, she said on Twitter Tuesday, to begin "personal and political projects which require (her) complete attention."

In a letter of resignation addressed to Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard, Delgado thanked Ebrard and Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador for her almost-five years in the role, but did not give further explanation as to her departure. (Reporting by Noe Torres; Writing by Kylie Madry; Editing by Brendan O'Boyle)
